DataElement.preferredName: Pregnancy Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale Assessment Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The state or condition of having a developing embryo or fetus in the body (uterus), after union of an ovum and spermatozoon, during the period from conception to birth._A 10-item, self-rating questionnaire designed to screen postpartum women for indications of depression._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The state or condition of having a developing embryo or fetus in the body (uterus), after union of an ovum and spermatozoon, during the period from conception to birth._A 10-item, self-rating questionnaire designed to screen postpartum women for indications of depression.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The condition of having a developing embryo or fetus in the body, after union of an ovum and spermatozoon. (Dorland, 27th ed)

Concepts.definition: The state or condition of having a developing embryo or fetus in the body (uterus), after union of an ovum and spermatozoon, during the period from conception to birth.

Property.preferredDefinition: A 10-item, self-rating questionnaire designed to screen postpartum women for indications of depression.

Concepts.definition: A 10-item, self-rating questionnaire designed to screen postpartum women for indications of depression.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ReferenceDocuments.name: The Edinburgh Postnatal Depre
ReferenceDocuments.description: The Edinburgh Postnatal Depression ScaleÂ© (EPDS) was developed to screen prenatal and postpartum women for the indication of depression. This 10-question self-report instrument is designed to screen for depression in the previous 7 days.
